1.text: My son! to my wisdom give attention, To mine understanding incline thine ear,

2.text: To observe thoughtfulness, And knowledge do thy lips keep.

3.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, And smoother than oil is her mouth,

4.text: And her latter end is bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a sword with mouths.

5.text: Her feet are going down to death, Sheol do her steps take hold of.

6.text: The path of life—lest thou ponder, Moved have her paths—thou knowest not.

7.text: And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And turn not from sayings of my mouth.

8.text: Keep far from off her thy way, And come not near unto the opening of her house,

9.text: Lest thou give to others thy honour, And thy years to the fierce,

10.text: Lest strangers be filled with thy power, And thy labours in the house of a stranger,

11.text: And thou hast howled in thy latter end, In the consumption of thy flesh and thy food,

12.text: And hast said, ‘How have I hated instruction, And reproof hath my heart despised,

13.text: And I have not hearkened to the voice of my directors, And to my teachers have not inclined mine ear.

14.text: As a little thing I have been all evil, In the midst of an assembly and a company.

15.text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, Even flowing ones out of thine own well.

16.text: Let thy fountains be scattered abroad, In broad places rivulets of waters.

17.text: Let them be to thee for thyself, And not to strangers with thee.

18.text: Let thy fountain be blessed, And rejoice because of the wife of thy youth,

19.text: A hind of loves, and a roe of grace! Let her loves satisfy thee at all times, In her love magnify thyself continually.

20.text: And why dost thou magnify thyself, My son, with a stranger? And embrace the bosom of a strange woman?

21.text: For over-against the eyes of Jehovah are the ways of each, And all his paths He is pondering.

22.text: His own iniquities do capture the wicked, And with the ropes of his sin he is holden.

23.text: He dieth without instruction, And in the abundance of his folly magnifieth himself!
